actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-489, by Mr. Frost.

Rule provides for consideration of the conference report to S. 3. The resolution waives all points of order against the conference report and its consideration. The conference report shall be considered as read when called up.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 120.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving all points of order against the conference report to accompany the bill (S. 3) to amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to provide for a voluntary system of spending limits for Senate election campaigns, and for other purposes, and against consideration of such conference report.

summary.text: Waives points of order against: (1) the conference report accompanying S. 3 (voluntary Senate election campaign spending limits); and (2) consideration of such conference report.

titles.title: Waiving all points of order against the conference report to accompany the bill (S. 3) to amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to provide for a voluntary system of spending limits for Senate election campaigns, and for other purposes, and against consideration of such conference report.
